'''Bazaar''' (formerly '''Bazaar-NG''') is a distributed [[revision control]] system sponsored by [[Canonical Ltd.]], designed to make it easier for anyone to contribute to [[free software|free]] and [[open source software|open source]] software projects. +
'''Bazaar''' (formerly '''Bazaar-NG''') is a distributed [[revision control]] system sponsored by [[Canonical Ltd.]], designed to make it easier for anyone to contribute to [[free software|free]] and [[open source software|open source]] software projects. As of 2007, the best known user of Bazaar is the Ubuntu (operating system) project.
The development team's focus is on ease of use, accuracy and flexibility. Branching and merging upstream code is designed to be very easy, with focus on users being productive with just a few commands. Bazaar can be used by a single developer working on multiple branches of local content, or by teams collaborating across a network.
